meaningMnemonic:
The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.

By itself, 文 can also just mean <vocabulary>sentence</vocabulary>, especially in grammatical contexts.
readingMnemonic: This word uses one of the readings you learned for the kanji: ぶん. You can remember this by thinking how whenever you're working on your writing, eating a <reading>bun</reading> (ぶん) helps you write better sentences.
